PQQyexH_OEBYY8PqTA7BNw.text: The price is right. The serving size is basically unlimited. The staff is helpful and attentive. I just wish the restaurant was a little cleaner.

k3Dv1WcW2cQiRky4Vju42w.text: Good food, good drink, good night!Try the Turkish Lemonade! It's a bit expensive but worth it.

wLatwFNI15lnTLm6IoJP4Q.text: It is absolutely gorgeous in the restaurant. The food is flavorful. They have vegetarian food and chicken. They also have pretty good service. The portions are just right.

qmHjG-BqHMoreusiSPEYzQ.text: We were totally impressed with this little find. It's a nice jaunt before theatre, and the service and value are tops. It's very well laid out, and the atmosphere is clean and professional without being terribly ostentatious.The food was tasty and full of a good blend of spices. Their proportions for their Meze were super-sized! We couldn't even finish what we had; and you definitely got your money's worth.The waiter was helpful and attentive, right before our rush to a show.

fWojCzf6mmp3Rckd1dlvdA.text: Great food very well spiced, Mezze Platter + Kuzu Pirzola with The Kazan Special "drink". Really enjoyed the meal.

zP5orXJpwjgxK9agHvZr6A.text: Been here at different times - quiet lunchtimes and a busy Saturday night - and been really happy every time. My last visit involved me revising a booking upwards for a Saturday night with only two hours' notice, but there was no hint of it being anything other than a pleasure. On arrival, I discovered that my European guests had arrived over an hour early due to a time zone mix-up but they'd been looked after really well. If anything, the waitress was more concerned about them maybe being stood up rather than them arriving too early. Food here is top notch. The 'Ottoman's Feast' set menu gives you a great selection of hot and cold mezze, which we'd have happily eaten as a meal in itself. The mains of various succulent meats are lovely. If you've got any room for the desserts, they also hit the spot. Lovely atmosphere, lovely food, lovely service. You really can't go wrong here.

qd2zwaOywSbxP2pS28knFw.text: Kazan is the place I go to when I want to celebrate something because it provides a setting that is cozy, softly lit and glamorous without being pretentious. I love the decor and the setting, the pretty ribbons on the napkins and the freshly baked bread. I was introduced by a Turkish friend of mine, and have been going back ever since. In fact, I rate it so highly, I'll only ever take my really good friends there because it's not just for anyone!The starters are all really good, I like Kisir and Iman Bayildi and I like the mixed grill for the main. The main course portion is just huge and because I go for the special lunch menu which has lots of little samples of the starters, I can never finish my main. All the food there is just really good and so is the service. They have quite an extensive wine menu and I've sampled their non-alcoholic cocktails which are lush as well as the mint tea which they pour the proper way..(with the long drop).

yFSs3SZnI-ilrNq80bu0lQ.text: The service at Kazan has gone completely downhill. The manager was so rude to our table the last time we were there I was shocked!  He suggested we go elsewhere next time. We used to go to Kazan often and had enjoyed it many times before so this seemed an over reaction.  We had only complained that the food was taking ages and ordered extra servings of chilli sauce (as it was so yummy) so we were really surprised at his reaction!

moqjG9kZBn9rmdJn7kMamw.text: The turks have a dish called Imam Bayildi. It means the Imam fainted (because the dish is so good). Well, I did not have the Imam Bayildi here. But Jason Bayildi. indeed. This is a Turkish restaurant with a lot of class and style, in both the ambience and the food. Literally everything was presented amazingly well. And all the food had a mastery and a finish you rarely find. Some of the basics, like Lokum (Turkish delight), were done so well as to be almost unrecognizable. I ordered the Ali Nazik, which was lamb chops with a tomato/chilli salsa over pureed aubergine. The presentation was great, but the taste was out of this word. The lamb was cooked perfectly, the aubergine had a garlicky spiciness that was refreshing, and the salsa was right on the money. For dessert... (I am just salivating writing this), I had apricots, rolled in pistachios, stuffed with clotted cream. And get this... where one normally would expect a pit... there is instead a walnut. So it's like "oh crap, there's a pit, can't bite through there... oh wait... YES I CAN." I absolutely have to come back to this place.

TlLasZnD5WOhi-Z48s6i3A.text: Went there for the Christmas set menu, was a delicious bargain at £22! Particularly recommend the meze platter - you can really taste the quality of the ingredients.

6tdO4ptf5t2dxJDOHqREJw.text: Probably the best Turkish restaurant in London. Honestly, it's really that good. The service is impeccable and its total value for money. The street where its located can be a bit of a nightmare but once inside you are transported to another place, where you can relax and enjoy your food. I can't recommend enough this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Kazan - London, United Kingdom

cFj5u-5VPwmoTWR6Gox62w.text: Kazan is not only one of the most exciting restaurants in Pimlico, it is a London gem.It has kept up its incredibly high standards since opening and the Chef keeps producing new beautiful dishes (try the chicken liver pate in pomegranate sauce or the duck/apricot shish--and you'll get the picture.)Lovely atmosphere and super friendly and efficient service.What are you waiting for..? Go!

9onMbzJjAdRK3fx8-j9TUg.text: This place is amazing! I had the Kazan special and the Turkish lemonade. The atmosphere is very intimate and friendly. The next time I'm in London I will definitely return here.

_M3TSnklQoJOhdfZknNDXA.text: I had a lovely meal here Thursday evening. The menu and wine list are amazing . something for everyone. Olives and bread was put on the table to wet our appetites. We had a share platter with the traditional foods for starters and the mains were huge. My meal was a seafood dish with prawns, monkfish, scallops and octopus in  a tomatoe based sauce with bulgar  which was delicious. our table also had steak, vegetarian, chicken , lamb  and all got the thumbs up. Our meals came out at the same time in a proffessional manner with two waiters . At the bill time we were presented with a gorgeous plate of turkish delight [the real stuff]   Its a bit expensive  here with a main averaging 15pounds but you can also get the mezze dishes for 5 and 6 pounds each. The wine list has everything you could want spirits, cocktails, mocktails, champagnes etc prices start reasonable and go to the top end  All water is available but we had tap which I like and I prefer to pay for wine not water.I love this restaurant its a bit posh but doesnt have to be. I think it would suit any occassion from an intimate date to a party of many , there is lots of room and a great ambience. some places you go to for just the food and some you go for a lingering dinner with company,  drinks and dessert with nice service and this is that place.

R5DiTNO3nWIB7CeRJtc5SQ.text: The food was really delicious, the ambiance pleasant, and the service prompt and courteous. Really very good!

cnR-Tx08yZa3a4WGqLWEcQ.text: Kazan is a good Turkish restaurant / grill which offers meat, mezzes and other foods. It is more upmarket in decor than other grills and you expect to pay a bit more for it too. While it is good food, it isn't amazing. There is a great grill around the corner on Warwick Way that has better food, friendlier service. If you do go on Kazan, you can often get discounts through Toptable

764zspXVI_6Jsh9wJcFlqQ.text: I liked Kazan, but I didn't love it.  We came for dinner and had mixed Meze.  The hummus with lamb, borek, and tabbouleh were all very good (especially the borek, which was very tasty without being greasy).  The Patlican stew and minced lamb were okay-- really nothing special.  I'd probably come back if I was in the area and looking for a good place to eat, but it's definitely not the best Turkish I've had.

K5Lf2yICsSoaXb47T9EGSQ.text: This restaurant is often quite busy and has a friendly crowd who go here. I've only eaten upstairs once and we had a private booth by the bar, which was good - although we were sat a little low! The atmosphere downstairs is absolutely wonderful here. It's quite dark, lit by lamps, but we absolutely loved this and it really created warmth and magic. The service was good and friendly and the wait wasn't especially long. The menu was good and the actual food was very tasty and very filling! Despite having A LOT of meat on the menu, there were enough vegetarian options to enjoy too.

6nTre-wPM8-cLFRo9RDFNA.text: I agree with all the other reviews: this place serves some seriously good food, with a very high value for money. The restaurant is cozy and pretty elegant despite not being very expensive. I went there four or five times (I live nearby), and was never disappointed, often very pleased. The cold mezzes are good, but in general I prefer their meat dishes: they're tasty, very rich, and normally accompanied by impeccable vegetable side dishes.

smHR5cPT-A-S5ECheJ_HVg.text: Wow, this place is fantastic. Some may criticise me for going to a Turkish restaurant and ordering a rib eye steak, but no one would utter a word of disapproval when they saw what beautiful goods were placed before me to make my rumbling belly smile.... It was simply, wonderful. This accompanied by a gorgeous bottle of red wine made it one of the best meals I have eaten in a very long time. I also tried everyone's more traditional Turkish selections which were also yummy but the steak is to die for, it even converted a vegetarian for the evening! The only criticism of this place is that it is pricey, but its not surprisingly because of its location and the quality of the food, and as the saying goes 'you get what you pay for' and my goodness its worth it, I would pay twice as much for another steak just like that one. The staff are really friendly and really attentive and the whole place has a lovely atmosphere, wow wow wow.

m_EJAeD87RrX1nlzvF2cUg.text: "Lovely" Turkish food in an attractive setting. Had the Ottoman feast for 29.95:Selection of Cold Mezze (3.25 stars) - hummus and other dips were ok, nothing memorable. Bread could have been tastier. Selection of Hot Mezze (3.25 stars) - Feta Borek (fried thing) was ok, grilled hellimi (firm cheese char-grilled) was tasty, sucuk (Turkish sausage) was good, falafel - have had better, was rather crumblySelection of Grilled meat  (4.5 stars) - definitely the highlight. So delicious, perfectly seasoned, and served with chunky fries that have a really tasty slight turkish seasoning. Dessers (4 stars) -  a plate with a little of everything: baklava, stuffed apricots, ice cream, and more Bottom line: Carnivore's delight and turkish sampler's delight.  Portions seemed a little small given that it's called the"feast" but you'll leave full from all the courses and meats. Will definitely come back for the meats.

rM1EIqFpGs04MqNuWalnDA.text: I should start by clarifying that I went to Kazan Kitchen across the street from the actual Kazan restaurant. Great experience though!Service wasn't great (running theme in London), but good enough. The food really stood out! The chicken wrap was delicious. Chicken was tender and flavourful and a bit of a bargain at £6.95. The chips that were served with it were piping hot and crisp and served with a delicious homemade sauce that I couldn't really identify but enjoyed regardless. It was very fresh and had a bit of a kick to it! Would definitely recommend!

E4mbrIDbWSRtvpMNc084mw.text: I happened to be staying close to here and we found it on Yelp and I'm happy we did.We popped in around 9pm which apparently is late to dine in London.  Event still, we were still given excellent service and I dig this place.We started with the hoummos and while I could taste that it was fresh, the flavor was not well distributed.  Certain scoops (on pita) were tastier than others.My Duck and Apricot Shish was, however, amazing.  The Duck was a perfect medium and the apricot was soft and delicious.  I opted for the rice and the salad.  The salad was dressed nicely and had a mixture of greens.  The rice was basmati? maybe and quite tasty.  There was a sweet and tangy sauce with it that I appreciated.We got a bottle of Takut with our meal which paired nicely.  The bill was quite reasonable.  Good little spot.

Ef0OOtJRZrxbzM5BdUxORw.text: The decor of this place is fancier than any other Turkish restaurant I've visited in the states. Dim and dark, it looks like it would become a nightclub after 12am.  My mates and I enjoyed most of the dishes that we ordered. We started off with the stuffed sardines that was wrapped in grape leaves.  Tasty, but watch out of the many small bones.  The hummus was a little disappointment though, as it was tasteless and the serving small. I ordered the lamb shish which was grilled tender and had no gamy taste. The roasted lamb dish that my partner had was also a winner, as the meat fell of the bone.  Overall an enjoyable dinner and the location is easy to find. Maybe it was because I was becoming familiar with the city and its streets.

cSMUxDqNtKC6vQM9Bfuq0A.text: I was here on a very cold rainy day , famished and a bit cranky I must admit. We were here around lunch time, since it was a weekend I was expecting it to be very busy but it was not super busy. We were immediately seated, a very good looking waiter promptly took drink orders and brought some really top notch bread. Warm, crisp on the outside and soft on the inside, almost a foccacia like consistency. it was very difficult to stop gobbling up the bread along with the olives and oil that accompanied them. We got 2 appetiser a cold and hot meze - eggplant stew almost, and spicy garlicky Turkish sausage. Both excellent. For main courses we got the Lamb stew over mashed eggplant (mine!) just delicious. I was very curios how the mashed egg plant might be prepared...it is almost like babaganouj with more texture and minus the Tahini. Hubby got the Meatballs in a tomato sauce, it was incredibly delicious. Dad got the Monk fish and shrimp kebabs, I thought it was lacking in salt, the good looking waiter got me some zatar to sprinkle on it..I was happy. Mum got the Seafood stew which was out of the world. The portions are just right (read not American portions) even then I was way too full. We ordered dessert but couldn't eat it, had to wrap it to go! Mum had Turkish coffee (of which I had a sip) ...again very good. Parents, Hubby and I are HUGE fans of this place, will definitely be going back on our next visit.

eJaTNHeVk33Mp6TLcY3G8Q.text: Kazan is definitely well worth its value in every way possible. It's quite close to the Victoria tube station, all you have to do is go down Wilton Road for a few blocks and it's on the right side.The waiters were very helpful and very friendly and did not have any attitude when I was talking to them. The decor of the restaurant is dim enough to create an intimate atmosphere. And of course, the food was excellent. It's well-priced and you definitely get your money's worth. The classy design that the restaurant has belies its friendly and quite affordable nature.

enWWULwSfRQ3vCoYO8PZRw.text: Excellent.I had dinner here on Friday. The staff were attentive, the food was lovely, the bill was reasonable, I even liked the atmosphere and the decor. I can't go around giving every restaurant 5 stars though; what do I do when I have a once-in-a-lifetime amazing experience? Don't anyone be put off by "only" four stars please, Kazan is really good. Four and a half stars good, easy.If you're looking for a nice dinner in the Victoria area, go here. If you're hungry, have the Ottoman Feast - we did.You'll go away full and happy. I particularly liked the cold mezze (all right, I particularly liked the array of delicious meats, but that's hardly a surprise. It's far more unusual for me to love things that are basically a form of salad)  there was a delicious beetroot and garlic thing which google tells me was kiz güzeli, and the tabouleh made me make "mmm" noises and comment about how tomatoey and good it was. They were also happy to bring us a jug of tap water alongside our wine and not try to upsell us fancy water. I always like a restaurant that does that.

Thugsu_iZO3SKXcGL3R3Qw.text: Let's tell a little story about an imaginary girl named... erm... Flora. From a very early age, this wee Flora lady loved her food - and contrary to popular behaviour of children her age, she loved trying new and interesting cuisines: Japanese, Nigerian, Caribbean, Spanish... the more strange veggies and spices the better. However she did not venture to eat Turkish food, as she thought that the only item on the menu was - wait for it - turkey. Poor Flora. If only she had gone to an amazing Turkish restaurant like Kazan where she not only could have tucked away in a seductive venue with golds and deep reds and magic, but she would have seen that the menu included everything from chargrilled minced lamb with kashar cheese, kirmizi biber, and king prawn, monkfish and scallops simmered with mediterranean vegetables. (And yes, you can guess why I ordered the Biber...) That's what I recently devoured.  And it was pure divinity.Poor poor Flora. (She'll be happy to know that no turkeys were harmed in the writing of this review.)

ry0DeK7cyMbVaSw3sG7b9A.text: We went here with colleagues. The service was excellent and the food was amazing.. All for a more than reasonable price imo. The place has a really nice ambience as well. I've had a rich starter, lamb filet main course, dessert, coffee.. spent less than 40£, tip included.

ZYJWzQCnkXhCt7JDZC3_Hw.text: We came here for lunch and we ordered the steak and stilton sandwich and a lamb kish wrap, and calamari.  The calamari was amazing! The sweet chili sauce that came with it was perfect.  The combination of flavors persuaded me to ask the chef what he used as his base for the sauce.  Luckily, he told me, now I just need to figure out what else he added to it.  This calamari was leagues above fish!  If you want excellent calamari, this is the place.  Both main courses were cooked to perfection and flavorful.  My only issues with the dish were that the salad and fries were not seasoned at all.  If they just take the time and season both sides, it would immensely elevate the dish and probably attract more customers.  The ingredients they use are already fresh and you can tell but to further set themselves apart from others, they need to do something about those sides.  I really wanted to give this place 5 stars but I couldn't because of the aforementioned issues.  I would definitely recommend this place and would come here again.  The staff were friendly, spoke relatively well English and the place accepts credit cards.  The décor of the place is contemporary.

bVIvmzRRemSbZHPgcJ0I7w.text: I think I just found a meat feast fit for a Turkish king! And here it is, at Kazan Victoria. It's great for group dining with the large round feasting tables and comfy corner sofas. The sharing meze makes for perfect party food and the wine menu is extensive. But, and there is a but, there is something just missing for me. The food is mouthwatering i can't deny that, it's posh Turkish fair, but in Dalston you'll get treats just as tasty and authentic for less than half the price. Also for groups over 7 you have to leave card details, what's with that?I would totally go again, but just not tomorrow. Actually I've eaten so much I may not even eat tomorrow!

BZ04y24SJPl4-x5At1oTuQ.text: I've been to several Turkish restaurants in London (and many in San Francisco, New York), and I can say that Kazan is one of the best. It's not really cheap, but their dishes are consistently delicious. I would especially suggest icli kofte and ali nazik. I promise, you won't be disappointed.

Ljw69t36VTokCuTMeCPF2g.text: i've been meaning to come here for forever as i love turkish food, and it's pretty close to my work, but i've just never got round to it. the other day though, i was looking for a place nearby to go for lunch with some colleagues, and this was my choice.it was great. very nice atmosphere inside, the wait staff were professional and friendly, and the food was delicious and well priced. we shared the fish mezze platter as a starter and it came with all sorts of fishy delights, and was a nice size to split as a starter.for the main course i had the tuvuk shish which is what i tend to always get when i eat turkish. the chicken was well cooked and flavourful, and the rice was like crack, as always (why is the rice so good?! generally i am not a fan of it, but i can't get enough of turkish rice. oh my life).when they brought the bill they also brought us a nice little plate of turkish delight which was a super nice touch.i'm definitely going to return here of an evening so i can enjoy the ambience at night time, and perhaps a cocktail or two...!

z7tACysnmMle_EVuK8ZCAg.text: The May meeting of the supper club saw us 10 strong and headed to Ms Kelly's choice: a mid-week Turkish feast at Kazan. As we were a large party we were seated at very pleasant table downstairs where our neighbours consisted, in the main, of a few other largish groups. A nice enough space but if I was in a couple or a small party I would certainly have preferred a table in the upstairs room which was more appealing with a cosy but opulent feel. Despite being a mid-week night both rooms were full and there was a nice buzzy atmosphere throughout the restaurant. We kicked off with a round of cocktails while we had a look at the menu. My Pomegranate Mojito was a nice variation on a classic, well put together and pretty good value at under £6. Plenty of choice on the menu, without being "war and peace", meant there was something to appeal to all our dietary requirements and quirks. To start we shared a few plates of the seafood and mixed mezze. These came with plenty of excellent bread which was much appreciated by our very hungry party. All the mezze were good and significantly better than many other Turkish restaurants in town. The smoked salmon was really very good indeed and the seafood plate would be my choice on a return visit. For the main course I had the Emperial Seafood Guvech which was a combination of king prawns monkfish and scallops in a tomato and white wine sauce which was served with giant bulgur. A well thought out marriage of texture and flavours, it was well executed and very tasty. Other mains seemed to go down well, although a couple of the party commented that some of the dishes were nothing out of the ordinary and a bit bland. Our end of the table were washing this down with well chilled bottles of Moko Black Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc; crisp and full of flavour this went very well with the fish dishes. The wine list had some good selections with plenty of choice under £20. Service was quick, friendly and efficient and the staff were good at dealing with the "demands" of our very varied party. While not a cheap option, mains are around £14 - £15, this is a pretty good choice if you fancy something a bit different for your supper in the Victoria area. Probably would have got a 4 if I had been eating upstairs. If you are in the mood for a pre or post beer one of my favourite pubs The Cask is only a couple of minutes away and is very highly recommended.

6JOBEZ-5McnsKJT4r5wROg.text: KA-ZAMM!  Okay, that was lame but the food was exactly the opposite.  I've tried several Turkish restaurants in London and been disappointed until Kazan.  It's quite a gem of a restaurant.  Upstairs is snug but intimate, decorated with rich fabrics.  Downstairs is normally reserved for groups but is equally nicely appointed.  The crowd is decidedly upscale - a lot of suit jackets for a Thursday night.  It can be hard to differentiate between low end and high end mezze, but Kazan does it well by using really fresh ingredients and serving up amazing fresh hot bread.  The mixed grill was cooked right - not too spicy, still very tender and not greasy - very hard to accomplish. Desserts were surprisingly creative: rose hip ice cream, a vanilla custard, apricots stuffed with cream and pistachios, a small triangle of chocolate cake, all washed down with fresh mint tea.  Definitely try to save room for dessert!

WfAH0rePqNs2HWtogU0e9w.text: This is a very popular Turkish restaurant, a few minutes' walk from Victoria station, with excellent food and restrained dark-wood decor. I've never heard anything but praise for the food itself, which explains its popularity. The set lunch at £10 is very good value. The evening meals, including a good range of mezzes, vary in price - expect to pay about £30+ a head for dinner. Plenty of vegetarian options available. The service has always been very friendly, although it can slow up when they are busy, as well as getting a bit noisy. Great for a get together with friends, but lunch is a better bet for business. Booking is advisable in the evening.

beQKP5xMtvk1HLpUa6i8WA.text: Kazan was wonderful - we shared a mezze platter that was full of clean, bright flavors and each of the entrees was delicious!  Friends highly recommended the lamb dishes, and both the chicken dishes I tried were fantastic.  Definitely worth a return visit!

kQnleuv7KS4X1_gE4P_u6g.text: Good food, very good bread and excellent service. Too bad it's a bit too far for my girlfriend and I, otherwise recommended.

Lnv5pez_esuaRVrlDtBSjA.text: It's a little overpriced but the food is worth it. Traditional Turkish meals  delicious. I also liked the perfect hygiene in the restrooms.

IE29Myj9APpd5b5eBbSbAw.text: bad foodbad serviceoverpriced.took my guest there for a treat and hugely dissapointed.

K0sBkfDPwDmMYI7cIIiTvg.text: I don't know if it is a cultural or language problem as my server had a thick French accent, but the service took away quite a bit from what would have been an outstanding dining experience. When I asked if they took AMEX or VISA, he went into a long explanation of why they did not take AMEX. I had to ask repeatedly if they DID take VISA. (They do.) Other than that, service was slow despite the place being half empty. It was also surprisingly noisy, detracting further from very good food.

pkpe6NeLKpFhQxgCu2eqdQ.text: I am a sucker for Turkish food, so this place was totally up my alley.  A group of four showed up on a Friday evening without a reservation and lucked out.  It sounds like we would have had to wait, however a group with a reservation failed to show up - SCORE!  We ushered into the side room which adjoins the main room with the entrance.  We were given a table that could have easily sat six and we were able to spread out and relax.  The room was somewhat dimly lit and a very cool vibe to the place.  Before dinner, several of us ordered a cocktail to start.  I chose the pomegranate mojito and was pleased with my choice.  The drink had a ton of the arils sitting at the bottom and I definitely tried to fish as many of them out as possible.We ordered a few mezes, I recall enjoying the cacik.  For dinner, I choice the grilled poussin (chicken) which came with yogurt, rice, and salad.  It was simply grilled and simply delicious.  One of my friends ordered the Imam Bayildi (a stuffed eggplant).  I think that was the best dish at the table.  She ordered it without the goat cheese, which was a wise move!  The servers were attentive and helpful with the menu.This was a wonderful dining experience in our home away from home for one week during the Olympics.

rmWlzPXEQtA9QV2NUispAw.text: Absolutely faultless.We were having the pre-theatre menu which at just £15 is a bargain.  Despite drinking only tap water and ordering the cheapest food on the menu, we still felt like we were treated like royalty.  The waiting staff could not have been any slicker, more polite or better turned out if they'd tried.  It was an absolutely polished affair of which the manager should be very, very proud.The food too was great; some of the freshest, most fantastic food I've eaten anywhere, ever.  This restaurant blows the socks off some of the finest restaurants in London I've been lucky enough to eat in.Finally the restaurant itself is beautiful; lots of quirky design features mixed with cool, minimalist Turkish features.To me this place is about as good as a restaurant can get - I will 100% be returning.

Vezo1qxKeyw9ybyOec38-g.text: I came here a couple of times and was considering it a good place to have diner so obviously, I came back another time with a friend a Saturday evening. We got a seat quickly even though the restaurant was packed.We ordered a starter each and wanted to have a piece of lamb that was labelled as "two persons minimum". We ordered that and the craziness started. The waitress had no idea how to deal with our order. She said that ordering one main course for two wasn't okay so we needed to order one each even though it was for two. She had no idea if it was coming with sides - it sounded unlikely given the price but there were no sides on the menu. After a while, her boss came to us and say that we were crazy ordering one piece of lamb each and we should share, as we wanted to do initially. Then, the waitress said that we can have chips or rice as a side. My friend took chips as the least bad choice and I insisted to get vegetables. At the end, we discovered that those sides were actually not included and we ended up ordering something we did not want.The service was simply HORRIBLE. One of the worst I had in a long time. The waitress shouldn't have been working there and following that experience, even if the food was good, I'm way less inclined to come back here. Sadly.

ndfjiI0PscAOG1Px145_Zg.text: Excellent Turkish food.  Great presentation and service.  The chocolate desert with pistachio ice cream was also delicious.

DHB92h68IIAXxMj3e0ncpQ.text: Not usually in that part of town, David Hockney took us there. Was entertaining some clients, and took them for dinner here. Very pleased, although not one to pay more than £20/25 pp for a good Turkish meal, which is usually in Green lanes. This was posh, but the food very good, which in im opinion is always inverse, ie more posh, less quality. We ordered two mixed mezze platters, one of which was seafood. Then each ordered a main, mine was Adana kebab, which comes with rice/chips and salad. The other mains were Imam Biyaldi n lamb kofta. Excepting my hubby , he didn't like the Imam Biyaldi, which he thinks is way better in Green lanes , Stokey. The Adana kebab was delicious, succulent, juicy and well seasoned, though was expecting two kebabs instead of one. If you are very hungry, may not suffice. Also ordered Baklava with rose ice-cream which was also delicious. The baklava was almost Gaziantep standard with a delicious pistachio filling and not overtly sweet. The Lokum they served with the mint tea, was great too. 45 pp, with two bottles of wine, 2 cokes. Pricey, but in that location, to be expected. Would go back.

5pB6T_IGQbQwqY6ZD6e85w.text: Appetizer:We had the Vegetarian Mezze Platter £13.95 Tabbouleh, Humus, Hellimi, Borek, Falafel, Kisir, Baba Ganoush, Manca.Main course:The Sultan's Shish Kebabs £14.95 Prime cuts of lamb marinated & char grilled with vegetables and rice.White wine: Cankaya Bianco,Central Anatolia, Turkey £17/bottleThe service was impeccable, and the atmosphere was very nice. Quiet music in the background, and light scent of incense.  We finished with Turkish coffee and Baklava.

mVTQgVCMXyu-RA4dtC0GEg.text: Have visited this restaurant on a couple of occasions with a large group and the consensus is that this is an excellent venue, the food is tasty and varied, the service is excellent and I would thoroughly recommend it. Can't wait to go again.

dL4PsjE2XDwSnWPkvBukXw.text: Get the lamb shish! Melts in your mouth and comes with rice and a salad. The only reason I have to give 4 stars instead of 5 is because the hummus was a little too creamy and lemony for my taste. But the staff is welcoming and the food is excellent!

sIp2GR8XVebWbzV7P11TRw.text: The portions are generous, so be sure to bring your appetite! I started off with the Turkish lemonade, which was refreshing and distinctly flavored by rose water. For my appetizer, I had a creamy, well-spiced bowl of delicious red lentil soup.  The soup was in a larger bowl than I expected and could have been a meal on its own. I knew I should save some space for the main course, but I had to finish it. It was just that good! Next, I had the Adana Kofte served with rice. Again, the generous portion was unexpected and I could not finish the entire dish. However, I saved room for some baklava served with rose ice cream. The meal was a real treat and I would recommend this restaurant to anyone who enjoys Turkish cuisine.

BCn6aeVEm0mPP7AtNxqeAQ.text: Some friends in London highly recommended this place, and I was so glad we ate there.  We arrived and we were asked if we had a reservation, but both times we went, they still accommodated us.  Lunch or dinner, the food was fantastic!  From appetizers to dessert, the food was so flavorful, well presented and simply delicious.  Menu had a variety to select from.Service was wonderful as well.  The waiters were always close by to make sure they responded quickly to the needs of the customers.  They were all so friendly.When I visit London again, I will definitely eat here again!

SpqQ1PCoLU13thI7P5Lz2g.text: Came here for dinner with friends, ordered a glass of white wine, and tucked into the delicious bread and oil with olives. Yum :)For the entrée I ordered Tavuk Izgara (£12.95), which was boneless chicken thighs with a side of salad, and an option of rice or chips (I got rice). The chicken was absolutely delicious, really well seasoned, perfectly tender and moist. I enjoyed the dressing on the salad as well. The rice was meh, just long grain rice.Our waitress brought the MOST DELICIOUS spicy-ish sauce to accompany our food. I'm not a connoisseur of Turkish food, so I can't say exactly what it is, but it was similar to salsa - chunky, slightly spicy - I could have eaten it on its own. When we first arrived, the service was really impeccable and attentive, but as business picked up towards the end of our meal, I got annoyed at how rude our waitress was. We had to wait nearly an hour before she brought our check over, and then another 20 minutes for her to come back and collect it, even though we gestured to her several times.

hoZFM_5DplbWRDuBsI9A6A.text: Came here for lunch today with 3 couples and it was very, very good. Everything we ate was excellent (although the humus was more creamy than we are accustomed to) and the service was superb. The staff were very friendly. The decor was beautiful as well. We plan on returning for dinner during our visit to London.

LSeahd9hgEtf5I_6P3F2WQ.text: Food was great. Service and atmosphere were great. But owner is what stood out most. We were paying and the owner came over when he realized the bill was incorrect and we were paying for the dinner price instead of the before 5:30 price. We would have never known there was a different price for coming in before 5:30 but the owner is a stand up guy. Highly recommend!

tSp9lLHpQ3PlJsTJZXx6rg.text: Seriously impressed with the food here - esp that the gorgeous flat bread was brown! There were 6 of us and we ate our fill with 2 veggie mezzes and juices. That worked out to a bargaintastic £8 each!I especially liked the babaganoush and the mini samosa parcels.  Deffo due a return here!Lovely decor too - very swish.. We were originally sat on a regular table for 6 but then after we asked, were moved to the posh padded booth. Result! :)

QMphB7-D4EOz-chJth4SQQ.text: Kazan is slightly pricey as far as Turkish food goes but well worth the money, I had the Sultan's Chicken Kebabs which with rice and salad was a hearty meal. The Turkish white wine recommended to us by the waiter also complimented the food well.My only problem was the low level lighting which made it difficult to view the menu through the elaborate lampshades, but that won't put me off making a return visit in the future.

c62wj1Vo-LkbJK6bM84etA.text: Went to this restaurant after hearing so many good reviews. The presentation and service was not a let down and staff were attentive. The restaurant is always busy. The food however, was nice but not the best I've had.

photos.caption: Photo of Kazan - London, United Kingdom

7Ii5Ve6aRyy9GvZkhWR2EA.text: Went there after the recommendation of a friend living close by and the food was delicious! The seating is not very private but not too close as well. The waiters a great and not too brash. I've had lamb, vegetables with rice and salad. The meat was prepared just perfect on the grill, the vegetables as well. Rice had a couple of chickpeas in it, just the authentic turkish way.They serve you with a cold chili sauce to every dish which I think is homemade with a special recipe. It fit well to the dish.After all it is great place to go for a casual dinner with delicious food!

8CDaF7spk5ykHdbBpQOawQ.text: This is one of the best Turkish restaurants I have visited.  I had the Izmir Kofte thought it was a great modern presentation of a traditional dish.  it is within walking distance of the Pimlico tube station.

photos.caption: Photo of Kazan - London, United Kingdom. Best desert in the world!
Photo of Kazan - London, United Kingdom

gVydX6xaTZzW0aNlIZtF0A.text: As a business traveler who likes to find new gems in different cities I go Id have to say this is one of them. The food and service is great. Finding healthy options when you travel as much as I do is key. This place had great options, the food was fresh and the service was very friendly & accommodating. I'm back on business this week and will certainly be stopping by.

BYBLvBzvByHm0Q76h2TqLA.text: The food was ok. The chilly sauce has a lot of ketchup and I couldn't test the real Turkish flavor in the food.  Mediocre wine selection. Nice decor and friendly staff. I won't be back.

m8VBnwUZ_tkXJko3_Ofr9Q.text: Delicious. Flavors were well balanced. Not too pricey, and the portions were more generous than you'd expect for a place that looks this nice.

UEKQqPQ1Mk6DZDHyl-SJag.text: There are not a whole lot of restaurant choices in the area, so Kazan offers a great venue for having a properly nice meal or holiday parties. The food is delicious here but not that authentic according to my Turkish colleague, then again, he considers most Turkish food unauthentic if it is outside of Turkey. Both the cold and hot mezze were good. As for main, I don't think anything quite beat the Sultan's Shish Kebabs. Juice cubes of lamb grilled to perfection with rice and salad. If it is good enough for the Sultan, it is definitely good enough for me. I have friends who tried lamb cutlet and chicken and they all gave good reviews. If you are in the area, it is a great option, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Kazan - London, United Kingdom. Lamb Kebabs
Photo of Kazan - London, United Kingdom. Char-grilled marinated lamb cutlets
Photo of Kazan - London, United Kingdom. Sultan's Lamb Shish Kebabs

7QxvmzBcWGjAkospBuBj8g.text: Good mezzes, but the highlight or our meal had to be the Kuzu Tandir (Ottoman spiced slow roasted shoulder of lamb with wild thyme & sea salt). It was a heaping plate of tender, succulent, juicy, seasoned lamb fit for a king!

photos.caption: Photo of Kazan - London, United Kingdom. Kuzu Tandir. Lamb as good as it gets!

K21U_5bUysL5VEJKXoCwIA.text: Due to its Ottoman heritage, a lot of Turkish restaurants pride themselves in their roots and take on the challenge of serving 'Ottoman cuisine', which is a step higher than your standard Turkish cuisine. Since the Ottoman empire consisted of such a vast territory, it is only logical that it's cuisine is a melting pot of different influences, coming from regions such as the Balkans, Persia, Armenia, the Kaukasus, and the Middle East. Ottoman cuisine, in one word, is indulgence, getting a taste of what Sultan Süleyman might have felt like. Something like feeling quite like royalty when high-tea-ing, right? Kazan restaurant is highly accesible by public transport. It is located at the Victoria Tube station, so we easliy got there by public transport. It is the first restaurant that calls itself Ottoman,to actually being worthy of that description in terms of interior; the whole room feels so luxurious and exotic with its golden detailings typical Middle Eastern patterns. I had booked a table in the lounge, so we sat on a comfortable couch with embroidered cushions. The only minus here was that they had stuffed the tables so close to one another that you could practically look into one another's plate. Not that the food didn't look appretising enough foor that though... On to the food! As for starters I took kadayif prawns, which are king prawns, wrapped in phyllo, fried and served in paprika mayonnaise. And boy were they good! I am a huge prawn fan, but the only person in the world who always makes them good enough for my liking is my grandma. But Kazan restaurant managed to exceed my expectations: the prawns were juicy but still had a nice crunch to them at the same time. My husband was absolutely delighted to see they had 'Arnavut Cigeri', (Albanian liver), which you cannot find anywhere in Belgium (and which is even hard to find in regular Turkish restaurants in Turkey as well). and he was absolutely amazed at the quality of the liver. Liver apprently is not easy to cook, and certainly not in that exact typical way, but the way I understood it from his gestures, Kazan nailed that one as well. Main course then; my husband had Adana Köfte; which is strictly speaking not an Ottoman dish, but a typical Turkish one, to be found in many a Turkish snack bar. Yet, the preparation method was what set this Köfte apart from the rest, since according to my lyrical husband it was; 'Adana Köfte on a Gault Millault level'. I had a kuzu pirzola, which are lamb chops, and I have to say; I cannot remember the last time I have ever tasted a lamb meat so soft, and so full taste. The fries that were served with both dishes were excellent as well. (coming from two Belgian residents, that says a lot, no? ;)) As for desert, we both had a little assorted Ottoman dessert plate with a delicious piece of baklava, a chocolate piramid, and some rose ice cream. Of course, this is just a small look into what Kazan has to offer, since the menu is so extensive. I just have one suggesition for the Londoner, or those visiting London; come and have dinner here, you won't regret it!

XQ_BTS4uptww38g1iPQWLQ.text: The food was so great and there is a section on the menu to order small dishes for £5-6 so you can try many dishes.

azXH9Fysx-XHmWp0rGrZuw.text: We tried the kabobs. Quality of food and taste were exceptional. Falafel lacked some salt but that can be overlooked easily. Service was polite and courteous as well. Will definitely go there again when back in town.

XP2Y34nhEVqeXLp6x-swbA.text: After a few days we were ready for something more than pub grip. This hit the spot! Great service. Food over the top. Get the grilled prawns on the starter menu. Four of us had different dishes and no one wanted to " share."

X5Hsuvj3dm06z8RrleeMgw.text: Note: there are two Kazan restaurants right across the street from each other.  One is "Kazan Kitchen" a more café atmosphere, and "Kazan" the finer dining restaurant.  This is for "Kazan".  Went here twice in the same week, loved it so much.  The lamb shoulder is incredible!  My wife and I couldn't stop raving about it - so much too that we had leftovers the next day.  Had two of the yogurt mezzes, both were really good.  Came back three days later and had the adane kofte - a spice lamb kofte.  Very good, was quite happy.  One of our new favorite London restaurants.  Note, the don't take Amex.

9625OBK27V8CuuCHUAR8qQ.text: Fabulous meal. Had the set menu option and we all ordered a different main, everything was delicous. Although I think the chicken was my favourite. Also had wonderful fresh mint tea and the bill came with beautiful Turkish delight. Highly recommended!

bi3DLYZr1hIeqN0gdgmJPQ.text: Saw this place on the corner while visiting London. The food was very good and the owner was very polite. The service was a bit slow to bring the bill as they got very busy with large groups. Overall a great place and great food!  Would definitely recommend

d1Crm_bFBEWZHNjwLGWgXg.text: Sincerely, I did not get why this place has much buzz around.Everything is on the wrong side here, let's start with the place. The environment is on the classy/high end side, with black walls and low lights. But everything you try to create is completely broken down by the fact that tables are 10 cm one from each other, making the place noisy and sincerely annoying. I just hate this kind of things. You as a restaurant manager shall decide what do you want to be, and then STICK TO THAT IDEA, do not try to add tons of tables to a classy place or you'll just end up in losing clients on the long run.Me and my lady tried the ottoman feast, as it seemed to have most of the appetizers present on the menu and a mixed grillade.First thing, THIS IS NOT TURKISH: it's just a middle eastern restaurant, it has NOTHING TURKISH. Cold dishes includes olives, hummus, beet salad, other boring non turkish stuff. Hot appetizers, a sausage, samosas and a couple of other stupid things (including grilled cheese, seriously DAMN GRILLED CHEESE).Mixed meat, lamb chops koftas chicken wings and chicken breast.Finally dessert, baklava, chocolate and ice cream.IT HAS NOTHING FROM TURKEY. Those things just make me angry, if you want to be a turkish restaurant BE A TURKISH RESTAURANT, DAMN! no yogurt (do you know the term yogurt derives from the turkish word yogurt?!), no ayran, no soups, no pilav rice, nothing, NOTHING!!It's disgustingly FAKE and places like that SHOULD BE CLOSED BY AUTHORITIES!Ah and on top of that, the food is not turkish but it's not good either, I mean it's not bad, but there is no reason for paying that amount of money for such a stupid meal with boring things...Damn, YOU ARE IN MY BLACKLIST!

XM409NMpR-nIiZ17NXPUPw.text: I lack words to describe how amazing this place is. The food is so perfect in every sense and I feel like you could pick anything from the menu and it would be heaven. I recommend getting a sharing platter for mezze (starters) because you get to try a lot of the great Turkish and Middle Eastern delicacies. Then of course they have amazing baklava and Turkish coffee, it's a must have! Also I can't stress enough how great the service was. The staff was incredibly kind and helpful and really made us feel welcome and attended to. They pay attention to the details which is what really makes a great place stand out from just a good place.All in all I would not hesitate to say that this is the best restaurant I've been to in my life.

rj0FzpIlFsnchwl2yFMYGg.text: Wonderfully tasty and reasonably priced Turkish food.  We got mixed plates to try lots of things.  Only thing that wasn't superb was the ground lamb.  And the milk shakes.  Otherwise this was the best restaurant we are at in London.

yyieT5LX8sogq1ECHaZXqw.text: I went  to Kazan for dinner after a hectic day. Trust me, the taste of food made me forget everything, I got so delighted after eating the food. I ordered a Tavuk Izgara (bonesless chicken thighs served with salad and rice). The chicken things were so well cooked and still juicy and soft. This was the best grilled chicken I have ever eaten. The amount of food was more than I could finish, but I still forced fed myself.They also gave me chilli sauce on the side (this is not the standard chilli sauce, its somewhat like salsa but much better). which paired very well with the chicken and rice.I had gone alone and so was easily seated even on a busy Sunday night. Service was great and the final bill came with small pieces of turkish delight, which were delicious! My girlfriend id due to arrive next weekend in London and I am certainly bringing her here!

HCSNkLmaDRh6KJfVsHTUYw.text: One of the best meals we had on visit to London. Great meal before or after theater at Apollo Victorian. Kazan special and Incik (lamb) out of this world - be sure to have their chili sauce.

Gb6q__H08AzGKP3wfdJGnQ.text: I have had dinner here twice now and I have to say the food is quite good and you can make it a tapas like dinner to share and therefore try a bit of everything.  Almost everything we tried I would order again.  The ambience is also alluring which is an added bonus.  I would certainly be back.

23rZVVmEbFHIZ6QaGANwyw.text: We came to Kazan last week for dinner when in London for our honeymoon. I'd love to have given the restaurant at least 4 stars, but the service just didn't merit it. The waiter was basically nonexistent, and we were hardly tended to. The vegetarian mezze were ok - the haloumi was grilled perfectly, and the red pepper-type spread was also delicious. Besides that, I thought things were too aggressively seasoned. For the main dish, I had the vegetarian shish. I have to say it was quite good - the feta was perfectly mild against the earthy vegetables, and the rice and salad were quite good, too. I felt the only thing lacking was that it could have used some cacik. I ordered a small side of it, and was brought the appetizer version for that same price. Overall, the food merits at least 4 stars, and the service about 2.5.

RVLN6olGnpK8VTpDgoeE7g.text: Great place and warm and friendly. Despite a busy Thursday night they fitted us in and the service was quick and attentive. The starter was incredible with at least 10 different tastes on the plate, a great surprise as we just ordered the standard all in one starter...a super choiceWaitress was attentive and kept the wine flowing. Mains were the mixed Kaxan grill, not a disappointment and hit the spot. Just the 4 stars from me but will return

gV-mYIvKUbe8pAVdqBBnvg.text: First time eating Turkish food and it was wonderful. Great service, high quality, delicious. There were 4 of us and everything we had was good. Perfect place to eat before a show at the Apollo Victoria!

83uU5sb_rc7gbrYmR-1U-Q.text: Kazan Kitchen was our first time eating Turkish food and we enjoyed every bit of it! This place was right down the way about 5-7 mins walk from our hotel in Westminster. For starters, the Falafel was crispy and tasty, and came with a creamy dipping sauce. The Baba Ganoush was also very good, served with bread. We also ordered the lamb and the "Limon I-tavuk" chicken (lemon & white wine sauce) which were both amazing! We were served rice and cooked vegetables (eggplant, peppers, and zucchini) with our meal. On our visit we had good service from a friendly staff. Street parking.

photos.caption: Photo of Kazan - London, United Kingdom. Lamb - best ever!
Photo of Kazan - London, United Kingdom. Baba Ganoush & falafel
Photo of Kazan - London, United Kingdom. Limon I tavuk chicken

g8qR9twYGuPik8khxCHHvg.text: Incredible food!Go to Kazan. Seriously, it's amazing. The food is out of this world. I highly recommend one of the platters to share. Best hummus and great babaganoush. The helimi and borek are fantastic as well. Everything we tasted was delicious. Good wine selection, extremely friendly and more than competent service. Ambiance is delightful, especially for dinner. No downside here. Reasonable prices. Went twice in a three-day visit to London. Don't miss it!

PGs_iaY0WWAeUEwrF6qGjQ.text: Two words: Hünkar Beğendi! This place does this classic dish of lamb on a bed of eggplant purée perfectly. The service was excellent, and I was able to get a glass of Turkish wine to go with the meal. Highly recommended to anyone looking for upper-end (though not terribly pricey) Turkish cuisine.

photos.caption: Photo of Kazan - London, United Kingdom

pUWfznVmRJcd1l21yR5kFA.text: Had the set menu for two for brunch. The service was very nice and attentive. I can't remember what the name of it was, but it was the one with all meat. It was pretty good. Of course, the best pieces they give you only a small piece of but distract you with other decent meat that it's still worth it. It came with a salad that was not excited to be there. Fries even less so. That's why I'm giving it a 3. The hummus was good but I've had better back at home (which is an international city but not like London so that's another mark). However, it was pretty full for brunch and I liked the atmosphere. If you want to try Turkish food for brunch, then this was fun.

cjHY0n0SFqHKSPt_UQOvow.text: Excellent food. Classic middle eastern dishes loaded with flavor. Excellent service. Make reservations.

OQqv0p0gFbQIxAqrFPPZFg.text: Came here for lunch on Thursday with a colleague who had visited before. The menu offered lots of interesting and tempting food and as I love mezze we stuck with a choice of six different dishes which were ample for two plus some lovely bread and olives. The portions were good and the taste delicious. We shared a bottle of sauvignon blanc and finished the meal with dessert and coffee. The service was great and the room was pleasant and filled with light on the first sunny day of April. My only slight pause in not going for the full five stars was the size of the bill which, with service, amounted to nearly £85 - which I felt was a pretty large amount for a mezze lunch.

-wJhZSqDM448FsAaB5zmYQ.text: We stumbled upon this lovely neighborhood eatery near our hotel on our first night in London. The food, service and ambiance was great for the causal meal we needed after a long night of traveling and a full day of sight seeing. The pomegranate mojito was the perfect pairing for all the delicious Turkish plates. We started with the hummus dish and ended with the chicken sish - a chicken kebab with rice and a salad. The price point was great as well: the drinks, apps, dinners and tip for two was less than 60 euros. Highly recommend this place if you're looking for a casual meal during your stay in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Kazan - London, United Kingdom. Turkish delight
Photo of Kazan - London, United Kingdom. Chicken kabosh
Photo of Kazan - London, United Kingdom. Interior

t0d20M0Wcmyu_6X7ANcqdg.text: The food was very good. The ordering process was a little confusing as the "healthy lunch" wasn't on the menu. The service was a little abrupt but the meal ultimately was tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Kazan - London, United Kingdom. Healthy Lunch

drTOsT8OfagdSjpa3hva4w.text: My husband and I stumbled across this restaurant while walking through the neighborhood. It was pretty packed and everyone in the restaurant seemed to be having a great time so we thought why not? The food is exquisite! We ordered the prawn appetizer, the lamb kofta, duck, and Turkish apple and ice cream dessert. Everything was bursting with flavor! I wish we had a place like this back in Austin Texas. If we ever come back to London we would definitely visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of Kazan - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Kazan - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Kazan - London, United Kingdom

aOqv82KZ_JBJrAX1tio6mQ.text: Ate at Kazan Kitchen. We did not have reservations but we were lucky enough to be seated. Reservations recommended. Had hot hummus with lamb, cicik, lamb and duck skewers. Everything was delicious! Service was very friendly. So nice to see a smiling server! Would eat here again without hesitation.

A0ieRHQ3eqGb00jcbkSpNg.text: Move on. Look at the stars, not the review, I'm tired, on a train and you'll read better.I like Kazan, it's a cosy, warm and inviting dining space, the food isn't the last word in outstanding technical detail but it's good, uncomplicated and hearty fare, won't break the bank (for the increasingly upscale area) and has always been a good place to eat.Easily wears it's 4* award.

photos.caption: Photo of Kazan - London, United Kingdom. Turkish light (it's been a long day)
Photo of Kazan - London, United Kingdom. Chicken Shish
Photo of Kazan - London, United Kingdom. Lamb and mash

YXHZ-IvTLZr14ZHgVubgDQ.text: I have had dinner here twice. It's reasonably priced with good portions and really yummy food. I would recommend sharing dishes so you can try a bit of everything.

5dyhUBjGcrWPIm9QKk79DQ.text: We found this place on Yelp, and decided to give it a go. Best decision ever made, this restaurant delivers on so many levels. Initially we were served a bread basket with a plate of olives (delicious.) We ordered tabbouleh salad and an eggplant purée dip for starters, and we got lamb cutlets with rice and chicken skewers with chips for the mains. The starters were great, but let me tell you, the lamb was cooked IMPECCABLY, just right. They were hearty chunks grilled on the outside with a pink center, it was so tender and absolutely delicious. The chicken was also seasoned and cooked to perfection, I didn't know you could get so much out of chicken breasts.The meal ends with a small plate of complimentary Turkish delights, which I've never liked, but they were so good that I had two.Bottom line? You need to visit Kazan, you won't be disappointed.

ZwohXBaXxIFYYmo79MJMsw.text: Great ambience, friendly staff and delicious food! I ordered some vegetarian food and it was worth trying. Would recommend this place to friends!

0UediuOytEHSa_fP8uBUCw.text: My husband and I absolutely loved this place. We didn't have a reservation and they were very accommodating, we were previously turned down at a couple of other places because we didn't make reservations. The food was amazing, loved the spicy sauce they offered.

photos.caption: Photo of Kazan - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Kazan - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Kazan - London, United Kingdom

cx4KUwS67wyFKhSXJfRSUQ.text: This place was recommended by a colleague and it was as expected. It's cosy and has great oriental flare. We decided to share a few dishes and whilst some of the portions are small since the prices are right, it's fine to order lots. We ordered the prawns wrapped in shredded filo, chicken shish, chicken wings, the sausages, baba ganoush, the harem salad, the goat cheese cotted in walnut and more. All were fabulous but my favorites were the prawns, the sausages and the salad. All the flavours were very fresh and I wouldn't hesitate to go back to hopefully try more.

AuNFP-A8Lr-ZizyW0V3jYQ.text: Visited Kazan Kitchen for dinner late in the evening and we thoroughly enjoyed each course.We were given complimentary bread and olives, along with our starters of humus and baked goats cheese coated in walnuts. It was delicious, and the main courses couldn't be faulted either, Kazan Special and Chicken Shish. Definitely recommend a visit here.

9Q_R9F0N1nOCx8zkGQ7BFA.text: A nice atmosphere with some interesting touches. Service was pretty prompt overall. We shared a vegetarian mezze platter that was really tasty, but we had to request more bread to finish it with. The dessert really blew us away. We had a variety of ice creams (rose, pistachio, cinnamon and Turkish coffee) and the baklava. And it was all incredible! Like eyes roll back in your head good. So glad we stopped here!

photos.caption: Photo of Kazan - London, United Kingdom. The bathrooms were interesting.
Photo of Kazan - London, United Kingdom. Turkish Delight.. Ready to head to Narnia now.
Photo of Kazan - London, United Kingdom. Vegetarian mezze platter.. Really delicious but we had to ask for more bread.

tPCh1rkrzQFUQN9uMmI6Iw.text: Went for New Year's Eve dinner with a group of friends. We all had a wonderful time. I highly recommend Kazan. The food and service were both outstanding! I will be back in February when I return to London. It was a very memorable start to 2018.

r5CVdg159CypatgZUX1DGg.text: Blueberry pancakes for breakfast literally had three blueberries in them. Smoothies were good. Steak and eggs.... well it was one egg and the steak was over cooked and under seasoned. Maybe breakfast just isn't their thing.

mFDcIE_wlixUIUs8HyjupQ.text: Great place to go before heading to Wicked. I was running late (why do musicals always start at 7.30 - why not 8 - 7.30 gives you so little time to eat) so only had time for the mezze platter. But what a mezze platter. Fantastic dips, felafels and fried cheese. If you are more organised than me you could get the pre-theatre menu by going there at 6.30 and it is £15 a head for mezze and main.

c63uhbJqqcA7KXyBLEJ3qg.text: Great food in a very pleasant atmosphere.  Waitstaff were unfailingly pleasant but a bit slow (mid-week lunch).

8x0IdcXyoo2ayEhW9wzZ4g.text: Second visit and the food/staff/experience was fantastic. What a great night.

vjpWpVYta3bNoP-gYqDlxA.text: This is a first class turkish restuarant in Victoria, I have been there with the family on a number of occasions and we have tried many of the dishes in the menu and they were all cooked to excellency apart from some exceptions.the restuarnat has three rooms, each one has its own decoration, with two of them using an Ottoman style decoration and the other using more usual design.Before going there it is worth making a reservation so that there are no unpleasant surprises, and asking about which room to book is also worthy.As I said, there are some exceptions for the quality of the food. Casseroles are below average, and Baklava is of a lower quality than what you might find in some local shops and it was the worst I have tasted in a turkish restaurant.Thier website currently shows a 50% discount if you book a table in thier branch in the city (but I haven't been there). and this restuant offers a take away menu (no delivery available). Prices are roughly 30-50% less than the price in the restaurant with the same portion sizes which is very good for someone who lives near by, as you might expect it doesn't offer all the items in the restaurant menu.

t9pEMCwftO66wr0K7SGssg.text: We were introduced to this place by friends. We've been twice since and thoroughly enjoyed each visit. I would strongly recommend the food, which is delicious and is great for both veggies and meat eaters. I found the service really good (particularly the Sir Ben Kingsly look-a-like waiter) but it is quite relaxed and unrushed, which may not suit everyone. Expect to pay about £25-30 per head with wine.
